etl.reader package¶

Submodules¶

etl.reader.directory_reader module¶

Module for the reader of directory-based datasets. It reads the dataset from a number of directories previously created and gives a list of filenames and labels.

class etl.reader.directory_reader.DirectoryReader(train_dirs: [<class 'str'>], validation_dir: str, train_mode: utils.train_modes.TrainMode)¶

Bases: etl.reader.reader.Reader

Reader for datasets stored in directories

load_class_names()¶
load_test_data()¶

It loads and prepares the test data to be fed to the input pipeline

Returns

a tuple with the filenames of the images and labels of the test data of the current mega-batch

load_training_data()¶

It loads and prepares the training data to be fed to the input pipeline

Returns

a tuple with the filenames of the images and labels of the training data of the current mega-batch

reload_training_data()¶

Reloads the training data. It should be invoked after a change in the training data. In case the data is being stored as a class attribute, then that class attribute should be updated within this method.

Returns

None

etl.reader.reader module¶

This module is used to abstract the reading of the data from disk Features: 1. Can load training and testing data separately 2. Adaptable for multiple mega-batches (changing the mega-batch and reloading data)

class etl.reader.reader.Reader(train_paths: List[str], test_path: str, train_mode: utils.train_modes.TrainMode)¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Interface for the reading of data (of a dataset) from disk.

This structure is based in the pipelines from:

https://github.com/ischlag/tensorflow-input-pipelines

change_dataset_megabatch(index: int)¶

It changes the target archive of directory from which the training data is being extracted. This ONLY applies to the training data and NOT to the test data.

Parameters

index – the number of the mega-batch, starting from 0. I.e. for the first batch, this would be 0

Returns

None

check_if_data_exists()¶

Checks if the directories or files with training and test data exists

Returns

None

Raises

Exception – if the data is not found

load_test_data()¶

It loads and prepares the test data to be fed to the input pipeline

Returns

a tuple with the filenames of the images and labels of the test data of the current mega-batch

load_training_data()¶

It loads and prepares the training data to be fed to the input pipeline

Returns

a tuple with the filenames of the images and labels of the training data of the current mega-batch

reload_training_data()¶

Reloads the training data. It should be invoked after a change in the training data. In case the data is being stored as a class attribute, then that class attribute should be updated within this method.

Returns

None

etl.reader.tfrecords_reader module¶

Module for reading a dataset stored in TFRecords

class etl.reader.tfrecords_reader.TFRecordsReader(train_dirs: [<class 'str'>], validation_dir: str, train_mode: utils.train_modes.TrainMode)¶

Bases: etl.reader.reader.Reader

Reader for datasets stored in TFRecords. Its only purpouse is to store the training and testing data paths

load_test_data()¶

It loads and prepares the test data to be fed to the input pipeline

Returns

a tuple with the filenames of the images and labels of the test data of the current mega-batch

load_training_data()¶

It loads and prepares the training data to be fed to the input pipeline

Returns

a tuple with the filenames of the images and labels of the training data of the current mega-batch

reload_training_data()¶

Reloads the training data. It should be invoked after a change in the training data. In case the data is being stored as a class attribute, then that class attribute should be updated within this method.

Returns

None
